title: Digitally-Enhanced Dog Behavioral Testing: Getting Help from the Machine. (arXiv:2308.06269v1 [cs.HC])
abstract: The assessment of behavioral traits in dogs is a well-studied challenge due to its many practical applications such as selection for breeding, prediction of working aptitude, chances of being adopted, etc. Most methods for assessing behavioral traits are questionnaire or observation-based, which require a significant amount of time, effort and expertise. In addition, these methods are also susceptible to subjectivity and bias, making them less reliable. In this study, we proposed an automated computational approach that may provide a more objective, robust and resource-efficient alternative to current solutions. Using part of a Stranger Test protocol, we tested n=53 dogs for their response to the presence and benign actions of a stranger. Dog coping styles were scored by three experts. translated_title: 数字增强的犬行为测试：机器的帮助
translated_abstract: 鉴于对狗行为研究的实际应用，例如选育选择、工作适应能力预测、被收养机会等，对狗行为特征的评估是一个经过广泛研究的挑战。目前大多数评估狗行为特征的方法是基于问卷或观察，需要大量时间、精力和专业知识。此外，这些方法也容易受到主观性和偏见的影响，缺乏可靠性。本研究提出了一种自动化的计算方法，可能提供一种更客观、稳健和资源高效的替代方案。我们使用了一部分陌生人测试协议，对53只狗进行了对陌生人出现和良性行为的反应测试。三位专家评分狗的应对风格。此外，我们还使用了犬行为评估和研究问卷（C-BARQ）收集了其处理者的数据。对狗的轨迹进行无监督聚类分析，揭示了两个主要聚类。
tldr: 本研究提出了一种基于自动化计算方法的犬行为评估替代方案，可以更客观、稳健和资源高效地评估狗的行为特征。使用部分陌生人测试协议，通过对53只狗的测试，揭示了两个主要的行为聚类。
en_tdlr: This study proposes an alternative approach for assessing dog behavior using automated computational methods, which is more objective, robust, and resource-efficient. Through testing 53 dogs using part of a Stranger Test protocol, two main clusters of behavior were revealed.
